contentrichtext.text: {{Inappropriate tone|date=January 2011}} {{Infobox person | name = George Munro | caption = Educator and Philanthropist | birth_date = {{birth date|1825|11|12}} | birth_place = [[West River]], [[Pictou County|Nova Scotia]] | death_date = {{death date and age|1896|4|23|1825|11|12|mf=y}} | occupation = [[Educator]]<br>[[Publisher]] | salary = | education= [[Pictou Academy]] | known_for = Rescuing [[Dalhousie University]] | website = | footnotes = }} {{Other people2|George Munro (disambiguation)}} '''George Munro''' (November 12, 1825 – 23 April 1896) was a [[Canadian]] educator and philanthropist from [[Nova Scotia]]. He was born in [[West River, Nova Scotia|West River]], [[Pictou County, Nova Scotia|Pictou County]], [[Nova Scotia]]. After basic schooling he became an apprentice at the age of 12 with a local newspaper known as The Observer. After two years he continued his education attending the [[New Glasgow School]] (1839 - 1842). After this he taught for a year to raise enough money to attend [[Pictou Academy]]. Around 1850, Munro moved to [[City of Halifax|Halifax]] and taught [[natural philosophy]] and [[mathematics]] at the [[Free Church Academy]]. He eventually became the school's principal before leaving for [[New York City]] in 1856. Five years later in 1861, he joined the publishing firm [[Irwin P. Beadle and Company]]. In 1863 the firm broke up and Munro entered in a partnership with [[Irwin Beadle|Beadle]] and ended up owning the company a year later. Munro became rich from his publishing company and in 1879 began donating to [[Dalhousie University]] under the influence of his brother-in-law, a member of the university's Board of Governors. At the time Dalhousie's total income was only $6,600, and the university was in danger of shutting down. In all Munro gave approximately $333,000 to the university (about $8 million in today's funds) which included endowed professorships and bursaries. To commemorate his generosity, a university [[holiday]], [[Munro Day]], is celebrated each year on the first Friday of February. == External links == *[http://www.biographi.ca/009004-119.01-e.php?&id_nbr=6322 Biography at the ''Dictionary of Canadian Biography Online''] {{Authority control|VIAF=9699696}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Munro, George | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = November 12, 1825 | PLACE OF BIRTH = [[West River]], [[Pictou County|Nova Scotia]] | DATE OF DEATH = 23 April 1896 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Munro, George}} [[Category:1825 births]] [[Category:1896 deaths]] [[Category:Canadian educators]] [[Category:Canadian philanthropists]] [[Category:Dalhousie University]] [[Category:Pre-Confederation Canadian businesspeople]] [[Category:People from Pictou County, Nova Scotia]] [[Category:Pre-Confederation Nova Scotia people]] [[Category:Canadian people of Scottish descent]]
